title: David Andrews believes this was most disappointing part of Patriots’ season-opening loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots' David Andrews highlighted the team's run game struggles in the 20-13 season-opening loss to the Raiders.
New England ran for only 60 yards on 18 attempts, contributing to the offense's second-half struggles.
Mike Vrabel addressed the issue, citing the need for more efficient and effective rushing to improve offensive flexibility.

title: Marco Sturm maps out the standard he’s setting for Bruins’ training camp
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Marco Sturm will lead his first Bruins training camp as head coach starting September 17 at Warrior Ice Arena.
Sturm emphasizes intensity, accountability, and a new standard, seeing opportunity in a retooling Bruins roster after last season's struggles.
Improved defense and power play success are key targets, with a focus on both experienced and younger players during training.

title: Worcester girl testifies against man accused of kidnapping her, throwing her off bridge
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Joshua Hubert is on trial for allegedly kidnapping, raping, and attempting to murder a Worcester girl in 2017.
The victim, now 15, testified about the incident, detailing her escape and survival after being thrown into Lake Quinsigamond.
Hubert has pleaded not guilty to charges, including attempted murder and aggravated rape, and denies the allegations.

title: Drake Maye doesn’t think he has ‘too much on his plate’ and more from WEEI interview
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye discusses his challenging NFL season start, saying he doesn't feel overwhelmed by the offensive system.
Maye threw for 287 yards, a touchdown, and an interception in a 20-13 loss to the Raiders.
Maye commented on Bill Belichick banning Patriots scouts from UNC, calling it unfortunate but supporting his former college team.

title: ‘Game 1 is always the hardest’: Patriots veteran shares perspective on Will Campbell’s debut
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Rookie left tackle Will Campbell faced challenges in his Patriots debut, allowing two sacks and committing two penalties.
Patriots veteran Morgan Moses shared insights, stating first games are tough due to unexpected plays not shown on tape.
The Patriots' offense struggled, scoring only 13 points, reflecting on last season's average of 17 points per game.

title: Kayshon Boutte reflects on his forgotten history as an elite prospect
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Kayshon Boutte was once a top prospect compared to Stefon Diggs but slid to the sixth round in the 2023 NFL Draft.
An ankle injury at LSU impacted Boutte's college performance and draft stock, but he's now a key Patriots receiver.
Boutte's offseason work reestablished him in the Patriots' offense, emphasized by his six catches for 103 yards in the season opener.

title: Hasbro is relocating its headquarters to Boston’s Seaport
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Hasbro is relocating its headquarters from Pawtucket, Rhode Island to 400 Summer St. in Boston's Seaport district by 2026.
The new headquarters will occupy 265,000 square feet and house approximately 700 full-time employees moving from Rhode Island.
Boston's vibrant business environment and academic partnerships influenced Hasbro's decision, aligning with growth strategies according to CEO Chris Cocks.

title: Wu heads into preliminary election with massive 50-point lead over Kraft
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Mayor Michelle Wu leads Josh Kraft by 50 points in new Emerson College poll for Boston's mayoral race.
Wu's support grew from a 13-point lead in February to 72% among likely voters before the preliminary election.
The preliminary election will narrow candidates for the November 4 general election; Wu and Kraft are leading.

title: Dunkin’ franchisee closes down production plant, lays off 74 employees
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: NGP Management is closing a Dunkin' production plant in Haverhill, laying off 74 employees by mid-November.
The closure affects 45 production workers, 21 drivers, logistic supervisors, sanitation staff, managers, and a baker.
A new Dunkin' manufacturing plant at 30 Creek Brook Drive in Haverhill will open by the end of the year.

title: Bill Belichick statue at Gillette? Here’s what more than 1,000 readers said.
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Patriots owner Robert Kraft hinted at a potential statue for coach Bill Belichick at Gillette Stadium after his retirement.
A Boston.com poll shows 46% support for a Belichick statue, while 52% oppose the idea.
Supporters cite Belichick's role in six Super Bowl wins; opponents highlight his strained relationship with fans.
